ccsu.cs505.statemanagement

Interface Store


  • public interface Store
    Stores the global state and provides method for managing it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> void addState(java.lang.String name, T value)
      Adds a new variable to the state with an initial value.
      void addSubscription(java.lang.String name, Subscriber subscriber)
      Adds a specific Subscriber to the specified state.
      <T> T getState(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the value for the specified state.
      boolean removeState(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the state with the specified name
      boolean removeSubscription(java.lang.String name, Subscriber subscriber)
      Removes the specified Subscriber from the state with the specified name.
      boolean removeSubscription(Subscriber subscriber)
      Removes the specified Subscriber all states.
      <T> void setState(java.lang.String name, T newValue)
      Changes the specified state's value and calls handleSubscription() on all Subscribers associated with the state.

    • Method Detail

      • addState

        <T> void addState(java.lang.String name,
                  T value)
        Adds a new variable to the state with an initial value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the initial value
        Parameters:
        name - the tag to associate with the new state
        value - the initial value of the state

      • removeState

        boolean removeState(java.lang.String name)
        Removes the state with the specified name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the state to remove
        Returns:
        true if the removal is successful, false if the state cannot be found

      • getState

        <T> T getState(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value for the specified state. Note: you will likely need to either typecast whatever is returned or pass the type you want via type arguments in order to use the returned object properly.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the expected value
        Parameters:
        name - the tag associated with the desired state
        Returns:
        the value of the state with the specified tag

      • setState

        <T> void setState(java.lang.String name,
                  T newValue)
        Changes the specified state's value and calls handleSubscription() on all Subscribers associated with the state.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the new value
        Parameters:
        name - the tag associated with the desired state
        newValue - the new value for the state

      • addSubscription

        void addSubscription(java.lang.String name,
                     Subscriber subscriber)
        Adds a specific Subscriber to the specified state. The Subscriber's handleSubscription() method will be called whenever the state changes.
        Parameters:
        name - the tag associated with the desired state
        subscriber - the Subscriber to attach to the state

      • removeSubscription

        boolean removeSubscription(java.lang.String name,
                           Subscriber subscriber)
        Removes the specified Subscriber from the state with the specified name. Uses the Subscriber's equals() method for comparison.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the state the subscriber is attached to
        subscriber - the subscriber to remove
        Returns:
        true if the removal is successful, false if the Subscriber it not found

      • removeSubscription

        boolean removeSubscription(Subscriber subscriber)
        Removes the specified Subscriber all states. Uses the Subscriber's equals() method for comparison.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - the subscriber to remove
        Returns:
        true if the removals are successful, false if the Subscriber it not found
